title: Medical Receptionist
description:

* Making sure waiting room is presentable

title: Medication Aide
description:
When you work at The Delaney of Bridgewater, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. What’s more, you are part of an extraordinary company – one that’s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Don’t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life!


The Delaney of Bridgewater is recruiting for a Certified Medicine Aide. The Certified Medicine Aide assists with the administration of medications under the direct supervision of a registered nurse or licensed practical nurse. Assists licensed nursing staff by performing routine nursing duties and activities of daily living.


**Here are a few of the daily responsibilities of a Medication Aide:**

* Assists residents with dressing, grooming, eating, bathing, positioning, turning, toileting and exercising.
* Gives treatments, performs tests, carry-out procedures and collects specimens as instructed.
* Reports and records observations and results of treatments, tests, procedures, and specimens when indicated.
* Transfers, transports, and escorts residents as needed.
* Answers signal lights promptly.
* Changes bed linens, makes beds and keeps rooms clean and orderly.
* Safely prepares, administers, and charts oral, topical, and suppository drugs.
* Checks and prepares each dose immediately preceding administration.

**Here are a few of the qualifications we need you to have:**

* Successful completion from a State approved geriatric nursing assistant training program. Prior geriatric nursing aide experience is preferred. Registration with State registry required.
* Successful completion of the State approved Medicine Aide Course, and when applicable, the continuing education course.
* Ability to understand and follow instructions in English, communicate effectively, and perform simple arithmetic. Ability to document care given.

Many roles in the community may require that we ask about your vaccination status. This could include MMR, chicken pox, hepatitis, and flu.


Hourly Wage: $23.50


***If you're an enthusiastic, compassionate, senior care professional who is passionate about hospitality and senior engagement- please apply, we'd love to get to know you!***

EEO Employer

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional) 17 hours/week after 3pm. MONROE. $23-32
description:
**Looking to hire a teacher's aide or DSP (Direct Support Professional) that is available to work 17 hours a week after 3pm- Monroe, NY.**

Seeking an experienced support professional who has chosen this field because they are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through a career in health or mental care.

You have at least a high school degree with experience in direct and active support of people with autism, down's syndrome, etc. or even better, a bachelor's degree in a field related to health and mental care: psychology, special education, mental health, behavioral science, etc. We offer competitive pay and benefits in a fast-growing, start-up-like environment where the right combination of independent, creative thinking and enthusiastic teamwork will guarantee career growth.

You will be responsible for supporting our program participant.

**Provide Safety & Support**

* Ensure health, safety and welfare of client with developmental disabilities.
* Safeguard and respect the confidentiality of the individual and their family.
* Promote individual's independence.
* Assist to develop and maintain relationships.
* Promote and protect the health, safety and emotional well-being of the client.
* Commit to person-centered supports and honor the personality, preferences, culture and strengths of the client.
* Work in partnership with client to support to lead self-directed lives.
* Implement and adhere to established actionable plans.
* Ability to communicate effectively.
* Be able to establish rapport and communicate positively with parents.
* Provide information to parents about behaviors and interactions with the child.

**Administrative & Company Policies**

* Commitment to company values and adherence to policies.
* Uphold the standards set by the National Alliance for Direct Support Professionals (NADSP) Code of Ethics.
* Be familiar with fire evacuation and emergency procedures within the home and community environments.
* Maintain all required certifications.
* May be required to report to alternate work location (job-coaching can take place anywhere in the community, within 10 miles)
* Report problems and concerns to supervisors immediately
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management

**Education/Qualifications**

* High school diploma required, bachelors or masters preferred.
* Experience working with medically fragile people and with people with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
* Valid driver’s license and impeccable driving record.
* Willingness to provide personal care.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $32.00 per hour

Expected hours: 17 per week

Application Question(s):

* Are you available to work 17 hours total during the week, after 3pm (school season)? What is your availability?

* any other language (Preferred)

title: Orthodontic Assistant
description:
We are Impress. We believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love.

We are the largest chain of ortho clinics with fully digital processes. We have revolutionized the invisible orthodontic sector with the best team of professionals specialized in making people smile and using the latest technology for the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of all cases.

Our business model, a true combination of medical expertise and digitalization has been recognized in the top fastest-growing Health-Tech companies by Forbes and we are currently listed as a LinkedIn Top 10 start-up!

Born in Barcelona in 2019, in just 3 years, we’ve grown to pioneer leading care, flagship clinics and state-of-the-art tech across 8 countries and more than 100 locations, and we are expanding fast! Our aim is to improve people’s health and quality of life across the globe.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We’re looking for an Orthodontic Assistant who is comfortable working in a fast-paced, digital environment and enjoys interacting with patients. In this role, you will use the latest patented technology in orthodontic care and will be part of a team transforming the future of our industry.

You are hard-working, flexible, detail-oriented, approachable, helpful, and positive. You enjoy staying busy, act with a sense of urgency, and love to provide an amazing, personalized experience to your patients. You will lead patient follow-up visits as a clinical expert, clearly articulating treatment procedures and goals to the patient, and acting as a liaison between the doctor and patient.

**HOW YOU’LL HAVE IMPACT**

* Communicate with patients in a friendly, helpful, and enthusiastic tone.
* Establish relationships with patients, making them feel comfortable while reinforcing credibility in a thoughtful, knowledgeable, and professional manner
* Tenaciously seek answers to resolve patient questions or concerns.
* Own the appointment experience with appointment preparation, reviewing the patient records via our EMR, provide an overview to the doctor, filling template trays with composite, sterilizing equipment, setting up and cleaning up the exam rooms, exporting patient scans and x-rays, and submitting thorough notes to our patient records.
* Manage the appointment flow, ensuring that your work and the doctor’s work is done efficiently to meet appointment time allocations.
* Perform procedures independently, such as indirect deliveries of orthodontic attachments to patients’ teeth and knowledge of how to use dental tools on a patient.
* Assist the doctor in all four-handed procedures, chair-side assisting, and bracket specialized cases.
* Maintain clinic equipment such as scanners, x-rays, and dental units.
* Ensure safety protocols are followed by all clinical team members by assisting with safety training and coordinating with the safety committee for best practices.
* Contribute to clinic initiatives to grow and improve the experience by delighting patient
* Comfortable using tools of an intraoral scanner, intraoral photos, and dental hand tools.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

* Prior experience in a dental setting assisting dental professionals.
* Team player with a willingness to jump in wherever help is needed.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills. Proficient typing (40 words per minute).
* Must be willing and able to be onsite in the clinic each day.
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule based on the needs of the business. This can include nights, holidays, and weekends.
* Must be able to travel between clinics within the market if necessary for operations and patient care
* Must be living in the market of the clinic.
* Adaptable and flexible - excited to work in an environment that is constantly evolving.
* Collaborative, empathetic, patient, and a positive attitude.
* Typical physical demands, twisting and ability to lift 45 lbs, able to stand for 8 hrs at a time, and coordinate movement of small instruments.

**NICE TO HAVES**

* X-ray and CPR certified if in the state of New York.
* Orthodontic assistant certified in the State of New York.
* Previous dental experience or recent dental assisting graduate.
* Experience working with EMRs, x-rays, intra-oral scanners, and uploading digital files preferred.
* Bilingual english and spanish speaking skills.

**WHAT WE WILL BRING**

* PTO and orthodontic treatment benefits.
* Opportunity for growth as the company expands.
* Attractive compensation package (hourly base pay plus bonuses)

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $27.00 - $32.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 30 per week

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Rotating weekends

Experience:

* Dental assisting: 1 year (Preferred)
* Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Orthodontic Assistant (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10011 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10011: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Delivery Driver (04955) - 350 Route 46, Suite 101
description:
**Company Description**  

Founded in 1960, Domino's is the recognized world leader in pizza delivery. Domino's is a company of exceptional people on a mission to be the best pizza delivery company in the world.

 **Job Description**  

Locally owned two store **Domino's franchise** looking for responsible, friendly, hard-working people to join our delivery driver team.


In addition to an hourly wage our drivers are paid cash nightly, which includes tips and mileage reimbursement. A minimum of two years driving experience, the ability to work weekends plus a CLEAN driving record is a must.


Our drivers are currently averaging **$18 - $25 per hour (hourly wage, mileage + tips)**

  

  

**Qualifications**  

* A valid driver's license and insurance.
* A minimum of 2 years driving experience.
* A clean driving record.
* Have the ability to communicate with customers and co-workers.
* Possess the ability to add and subtract accurately and quickly.
* Be friendly!

  

**Additional Information**  

We take pride in our team members. Being the best delivery company in the world requires exceptional team members working together. Our mission is to recognize, appreciate, value and utilize the unique talents and contributions of all individuals. To create an environment where all team members can reach their highest potential. At Domino's our people come first!


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Executive Assistant
company: New Jersey Coalition to End Homelessness
description:
**Who We Are:** 

The New Jersey Coalition to End Homelessness (NJCEH) is a statewide, social impact organization [a 501(c)(3) non-profit] with one goal: to eradicate homelessness in New Jersey. Toward that end, the Coalition will advocate, educate, organize and, if necessary, litigate for emergency and permanent solutions to homelessness.

At the Coalition, our plan for improving shelters across the state is two-fold:

* Help the policymakers get it right by promoting common sense, proven ideas backed by the wisdom of people on the frontlines of helping the homeless, and people with lived experience of homelessness.
* Help the helpers do it right through unprecedented collaboration and support among New Jersey shelters.

Key to reaching these goals is a masterful Executive Assistant who will play a critical role in the success of organization, taking full ownership of key responsibilities and ensuring the smooth execution of daily operations with exceptional efficiency and dedication.

**What You Will Do:** 

As the Executive Assistant, you will report directly to our CEO. You will help with a variety of tasks that require you to be highly organized and work independently. This role requires you to be in-person at our Princeton office at least 3 days a week.

**Executive Support:** 

* Efficiently manage our CEO’s calendar, scheduling meetings, appointments, and events to optimize their time and priorities.
* Act as a liaison between our CEO and key stakeholders.
* Assist with special projects and initiatives, providing research, analysis, and administrative support as required.

**Office Operations:** 

* Support the smooth running of the office, including managing supplies, coordinating office events, and handling administrative tasks.
* Prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously, identifying urgent matters and ensuring timely resolution.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting for staff and identify consultants to reach out to if further help is required.
* Prepare, print, and distribute agendas, documents, and materials for meetings or donor communication.

**Data Management:** 

* Maintain and organize files and documents in an easy to access way.
* Ensure compliance is met under our grant agreements including identifying deadlines and reporting requirements.

**Who You Are:** 

* Passion for creating robust change.
* Excellent communication and relationship-building abilities.
* Willing to grow knowledge on homelessness issues, policies, and best practices.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Zoom, and other relevant software applications.
* Flexibility as projects and tasks are constantly changing.
* Great attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently.
* Ability to multitask; able to juggle an assortment of diverse projects.
* Excited to join a team that is making a difference nationally.

To apply for this job, please be sure to include both a resume and cover letter.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

title: Part Time Sales Associate
description:
***ABOUT THE JOB:***

This opening is at our beautiful \\_ **Short Hills NJ Gerard Darel - Bloomingdale's** \\_

**ABOUT: GERARD DAREL**

Founded in 1971 by Gerard and Daniele Darel, the company runs its wholesale and retail business headquarters in Paris, France. The charm and essence of Gerard Darel lies in the timeless top-quality women’s wear and accessories collections. Products are seamlessly incorporated into the lives and wardrobe of elegant modern women. Darel’s designs accent a woman’s independence, strength, and personal style, rather than dictating them. Designed for morning to night, the clothes embody a vibrant modern lifestyle, they are beautiful, easy to wear and lend themselves to versatility.

A Gerard Darel Sales Professional is self-motivated, fast-paced, a multi-tasker and goal-oriented. Our top Sales Professionals exhibit a passion for client focused selling, an entrepreneurial spirit, strong attention to detail, organization, and are reliable and efficient. All Gerard Darel team members are ambassadors of a Parisian heritage brand. They understand and communicate the Gerard Darel philosophy of being Timeless & Modern. Above all, our team truly enjoys the whole retail experience and love what they do!

**Skills Summary**

* At Gerard Darel our sales professionals exhibit a passion for our product and clients, create exceptional one-of-a-kind experiences and identify the clients’ needs by providing a customized shopping experience
* The ideal candidate must be team and goal-oriented, able to provide a positive and welcoming environment for all clients, capable of engaging, building and maintaining a client base, and achieve/exceed sales objectives
* Other qualities include; ability to communicate effectively with clients, colleagues, and management, exhibit an energetic outgoing personality, and always maintain a positive attitude
* 2+ years of luxury retail sales experience. Boutique setting background a plus

**Job Responsibilities** (**Part Time Style Advisor**)

* Understand and excel at meeting and exceeding sales expectations.
* Provide every client with exceptional service from start to finish.
* Cultivating relationships with new and existing clientele.
* Showcase expertise in fit, cut, fabrication, and embody the Gerard Darel way of styling.
* Ensure store standards are maintained and elevated (i.e. merchandising, visuals, shipment processing, cleanliness, inventory levels, stockroom organization, and safety) in accordance with company policy and procedures.
* Awareness of current fashion trends.
* Maintains knowledge of current and upcoming promotional opportunities.
* Executes promotional campaigns, product placement, and timely marketing strategies.
* Ability to work both as part of a productive team and independently.
* Maintains inventory reliability through accurate processing of register transactions (sales, returns, and exchanges), loss prevention standards and providing accurate information to clients.

**Core Competencies for All Team Members:**

* Client Focus: Dedicated to exceeding client expectations within each interaction; customer first mentality; actively establishes and maintains customer relationships for future business
* Results Driven: Consistent in delivering sales metrics; focused on participating in team mentality; knows and understands goals clearly and is able to execute over time
* Authenticity: Exhibit this fundamental value of success; Authentic interactions with clients and fellow team members
* Receptive to Feedback: Eagerness to learn and grow within our company; Evolving as times change to better business and represent brand at the highest level
* Assimilate New Ideas: Learn and adapt to new ways of doing business and facilitating a high level of service and brand presentation

**Requirements and Qualifications**

* REQUIRED: Minimum of 2-3 years of sales experience in a luxury retail environment.
* Proficient in POS systems, and possess excellent and clear communication skills.
* Capability to move objects (up to 50 lbs) while working on the selling floor and backroom.
* Ability to work flexible hours including morning, mid, evening and weekend shifts.

**Compensation**

* We offer a seasonal clothing allowance package and employee discount.
* Monthly bonus package based on store performance.
* We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

A Sales Professional forms and maintains professional relationships with peers, executives and clients. A Gerard Darel Selling Specialist is flexible to the varying requirements of the business and complies with the Gerard Darel standards, procedures and policies.

Your primary responsibility will be to assist in creating engaging lesson plans that cater to the needs of our students, while tending to the needs of all young children, change diaper/diaper training, and help create a nurturing and safe environment for our children.

- Strong classroom management skills, with the ability to create a positive and engaging environment.

- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with students, colleagues, and parents.

- Experience in lesson planning and curriculum development is preferred.

\\*\\*Skills:\\*\\*

- Experience with curriculum development and lesson planning.

- Understanding of childhood development and the needs of students with autism.

title: General Manager (04955) - 350 Route 46, Suite 101
description:
**Company Description**  

Founded in 1960, Domino's is the recognized world leader in pizza delivery. Domino's is a company of exceptional people on a mission to be the best pizza delivery company in the world.

 **Job Description**  

Locally owned two store **Domino's franchise** looking for responsible, friendly, hard-working people to join our management team!


You will learn all aspects of this hands-on position from the ground up!


You were born to be the boss. We know. You get up in the morning and you make sure everyone else in the house is doing what they need to do. You then go to work and make sure that everyone there is doing what they need to do, even your boss. You just do that because you've always done it. Well maybe it's time you moved up. You want to be the boss? Well now's your chance - Domino's is hiring bosses - more specifically general managers. It's a tough job, one that needs a natural like you. Of course, you'll need some skills - judgment, math and the ability to multitask.


You'll be working for a company that's fun and flexible. Not to mention, it's work experience you're going to use for a long time to come. You've had our pizza delivered to you, now help us be the best in pizza delivery. Go on, boss, show us what you've got. Apply now!

* Health, Dental & Vision benefits available.
* 401K Plan available.
* Salaried position commensurate with experience.

  

**Qualifications**  

You will be responsible for everything that happens during your shift. This includes all cost controls, inventory control, cash control and Customer relations. You must set the example. You must follow ALL policy and procedures 100% of the time and expect the same from your crew.


Additionally, you will be responsible for: staffing, paperwork, cost controls, cash control, food management, working to a schedule, perfect Image and adherence to standards, great customer service, attendance & punctuality, transportation to/from work, store cleanliness, marketing and profitability.

* Prior pizza making experience is a plus.
* Flexible schedules.
* Some nights and weekends required.
* Clean background check, valid license and vehicle a must.

  

**Additional Information**  

We take pride in our team members. Being the best delivery company in the world requires exceptional team members working together. Our mission is to recognize, appreciate, value and utilize the unique talents and contributions of all individuals. To create an environment where all team members can reach their highest potential. At Domino's our people come first!


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:
Roof Maxx is a revolutionary roof rejuvenation spray. We provide the only 100% Eco-friendly product on the market to homeowners with older roofs. We help our clients extend the life of their roof while saving them money!

We recruit, train, and retain talented individuals with a drive to succeed. We are an expectation-shattering, happiness-maximizing company dedicated to growth.

**Entry Level Sales Representative**

As a full-time entry-level sales representative you’ll be trained to deliver a proven sales presentation to consumers that truly need what you offer.

You will not have to generate your own leads. We have a pre-qualification process that ensures we are putting our sales representatives in the best possible position to succeed.

We only ask that as an entry level rep, you learn our primary product lines, and always stay true to your training.

* Develop relationships with pre-qualified prospective customers

Start as entry level and learn to be a top producer within weeks. Get paid well to turn your dedication into a skill set that will be transferable throughout other areas of your life!

title: IT Technical Proctor for Professional Exam
description:
**ABOUT UNIO TECH SOLUTIONS**

Unio Tech Solutions offers a full range of IT services and special projects for Fortune 500 companies, government agencies and the largest brands throughout Canada and the USA. Our services include technology relocation (disconnecting and reconnecting computer hardware during office moves – monitors, docks, keyboards, mice), installation of new equipment, IT Inventories, exam proctoring, cable management, secure electronic recycling, server room services, AV services and office decommissioning. Our clients include companies such as GE, Puma, Ford, Uber, Sephora, Home Depot.

**JOB SUMMARY**

We are looking for responsible, tech savvy and enthusiastic individuals to help with a special project – it is the role of Technical Proctor for a prototype high stakes’ professional exam. Your job is to provide hands-on IT support to students writing this prototype exam.

**DATES & HOURS:**

This is a contract position working 1-2 days (online training) in the first two weeks of October **(approx. 2 hours per session)**, 1 set-up day for IT hardware **(October 16th - approx. 2-3 hours)** and 3 days in a row onsite Thursday, Friday, Saturday (**October 17, 18, 19, 2024)** directly at the proctoring test centers. Hours will be approximately 9 hours per day for the 3 exam days.

The ideal candidate works well independently, has excellent communication skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical problems quickly in an exam setting.

**Important**: Those applying for the position should not be law school students, anyone who intends to take the bar exam, law school staff, or anyone associated with bar prep companies.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:**

Providing Technical Support to the Exam Proctor including the following processes:

* Downloading of a single back-up exam to each back-up device on-site.
* Set-up of back-up devices on-site prior to exam session.
* Support exam proctors with exam upload checks.
* Support exam proctors with resuming candidate exams where required.
* Network connectivity troubleshooting.
* Student exam IT Support such as swapping a student laptop with a backup laptop if they cannot access the exam online or have Wi-Fi connectivity issues.
* Pre-exam support including receiving back-up laptops, testing their Wi-Fi and bringing them to the test centers.

Being available the following Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday: **October 16, 17, 18, 19, 2024 as well as 2 online training sessions in early October.**

**TECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIRED:**

* Proficiency in Windows and Mac operating systems: Expertise in
* troubleshooting and resolving common issues on Windows and Mac
* environments.
* Network connectivity troubleshooting: Strong knowledge of diagnosing
* and resolving Wi-Fi and connection problems.
* Technical support experience: Proven track record in a technical support
* or IT helpdesk role, providing effective solutions to end-users.
* Familiarity with exam software: Experience with online exam tools and
* platforms.

Technical Proctors will be provided with training to support the above functionality.

**OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:**

- Strong communication skills and ability to demonstrate a high level of professionalism.  
- Ability to remain calm and composed to support test-takers writing an exam in a high stakes environment.  
- Ability to pass a criminal records check.  
- Availability to work the dates and hours during the exams in your city/state.  
- Applicant may not have applied or be in the process of applying to pass the bar exam.  
- IT certifications: Certifications in IT support or related fields (e.g., CompTIA A+,  
- Microsoft Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator) are an asset.  
- Exam administration: Previous experience with supporting candidate exam sessions is an asset.  
- Those with a valid driver’s license, and a car are an asset.

**APPLICATION PROCESS:**

Please submit your resume and cover letter through Indeed. Those candidates who meet our requirements will be contacted for an interview.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $20.00 - $35.00 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: CEO
description:
Job Description: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) – Clothing Recycling Company

Industry: Fashion Sustainability & Waste Management

\\*\\*Overview\\*\\*

Thriftier.USA is a New York City based startup that focuses on a 360 approach to clothing recycling, fashion recycling, and waste management for the United States. We provide an integrated WM solution that starts the home of everyday consumers. It forges the partnership between retail, government, and consumer that bridges the gaps of sustainability and innovation when it comes to how we can lower global emissions through redistributing uses for disposed fashion, materials, and accessories.

We are seeking a new CEO Candidate for Thriftier USA that is a visionary and strategic thinker and executor. He or She is responsible for leading and scaling a clothing recycling company in its trajectory of growth. The candidate should have experience managing a company from early rounds of funding into successful Initial Public Offering (IPO). The CEO will be a stakeholding visionary driving strategic growth. This individual will also work closely with the CFO, Managing Director, Marketing stakeholders, Operations Director board of directors, investors, and the executive team to develop and execute the company’s mission of transforming how textiles are recycled and reused from the national level.

\\*\\*Position Overview:\\*\\*

* The Chief Executive Officer (CEO) will be responsible for carrying out the vision of the company's Board, and the operational strategy of the company's growth, expansion, visibility, and relevance to the public market and government client sectors.
* He or She should have proven experience in carrying out an intentional strategy for a seed to IPO trajectory.
* Candidates should have a clear strategy for engaging a city-by-city regional rollout across each market of the company's expansion plan.
* The candidate should be both practical and creative with exploring and forging necessary relationships with city government, the EPA, and the federal government as needed on behalf of the service provider .
* The candidate should oversee the marketing team's strategy in connection with public rollout and awareness.
* He or she should be familiar with fundraising ramp up and compliance from seed to IPO.
* The candidate's role will oversee Brand Relations Manager responsible retailer brand relationships and wholesale sales accounts.
* The role will also oversee Operational Manager who maintains and governs wholesale shipments, product delivery logistics, and inventorying operations during the duration of seed to IPO timeline.

\\*\\*Key Responsibilities:\\*\\*

1. \\*\\*Leadership & Vision\\*\\*

- Set the strategic direction org matrix, aligning all efforts with long-term growth goals.

- Lead marketing arm to communicate a clear vision for sustainable textile recycling that resonates with consumers, partners, and investors.

- Participate in a corporate culture that emphasizes sustainability, innovation, and responsibility.

- Represent the company publicly, building brand awareness in industry forums, media, and investor events etc as needed.

2. \\*\\*Fundraising & Financial Management\\*\\*

- Lead the company through multiple funding rounds, including seed, Series A, and beyond, culminating in an IPO.

- Manage relationships with existing and potential investors, providing them with clear and transparent updates on financial performance and business milestones.

- Oversee the company’s financial performance, working with the CFO to manage budgets, forecasts, and profitability.

3. \\*\\*Growth & Market Strategy\\*\\*

- Develop and execute a growth strategy that captures market share in the circular fashion and recycling sectors.

- Identify and explore new business opportunities, partnerships, and market segments to drive long-term value.

- Continue to position the company as an industry leader, ensuring competitive differentiation and innovative approaches to recycling.

4. \\*\\*IPO Preparation & Execution\\*\\*

- Lead the company’s transition from private to public, including IPO preparation and execution.

- Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and maintain strong corporate governance throughout the process.

- Work closely with investment bankers, lawyers, and auditors to successfully navigate the IPO process.

5. \\*\\*Team Leadership\\*\\*

- Build and lead an executive leadership team capable of executing the company’s vision.

- Foster a high-performance culture by attracting, retaining, and developing top talent.

6. \\*\\*Sustainability & Corporate Responsibility\\*\\*

- Ensure the company adheres to the highest environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards.

- Promote sustainability initiatives that minimize the environmental impact of textile waste and position the company as a responsible corporate citizen.

\\*\\*Key Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Proven experience as a CEO or senior executive in a high-growth company, preferably within sustainability, recycling, fashion, waste management, or related industries.

- Experience leading a company from early-stage funding through IPO is highly preferred.

- Strong knowledge of the circular economy and sustainable business models.

- Demonstrated ability to fundraise and manage investor relations.

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while managing growth and change.

\\*\\*Education & Experience:\\*\\*

- Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Sustainability, or a related field (MBA or other advanced degrees preferred).

- 10+ years of experience in executive management, with a strong track record of success in building and growing businesses.

\\*\\*Location:\\*\\*

- The role will be based at the company’s headquarters, with flexibility for remote work as needed.

\\*\\*Compensation:\\*\\*

- Competitive salary and equity package, commensurate with experience and company growth milestones.

www.thriftierusa.com

title: Crane/Rigger planner
description:
**Position Overview:**

The Crane Lift Planner is needed for tank installations utilizing cranes.

Duties would include:

* Perform site visits and meet with customers and construction managers to: determine lift parameters, crane sizes and other required equipment (lifts, man baskets, etc.) to install tanks.
* Provide quotes based on equipment and personnel required
* Develop lift plan and lift plan drawings for customer approval and as required for RFQ’s received from customers.
* Schedule cranes, lifts, and any other equipment for job and execute jobs on site.
* Execute lift work as lift supervisor; hands-on outdoor work.

Requirements:

* 2 or 4 year Mechanical engineering degree and minimum of 3 years’ experience working with cranes; or 10 years’ experience in crane and rigging with 5 years as lift supervisor or commensurate experience in crane and rigging industry evidenced by master rigger and/or lift supervisor license or certifications.
* Good spatial reasoning abilities
* High regard for recognized job site safety requirements and procedures.
* Ability to travel 60% of time, extensively by car and truck throughout Northeast from VA to ME.

For over 125 years, OPW has led the way in designing and manufacturing world-class retail fueling, fluid handling and car wash system solutions for the safe and efficient handling and distribution of fuels and critical fluids. OPW makes above ground and below ground products for both conventional, vapour recovery and clean energy applications in the retail and commercial markets. Additionally, OPW supplies loading arms, valves and dry-break couplings, tank truck equipment, rail car valves and equipment, and car wash systems. OPW has manufacturing operations in North America, Europe, Latin America and Asia Pacific, with sales offices around the world. OPW is part of the Dover Corporation, which is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under 'DOV'. To learn more about OPW’s 125 years of providing industry-leading solutions, visit our website at www.opwglobal.com.

Dover is a diversified global manufacturer with annual revenue of over $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, specialty systems, consumable supplies, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments: Engineered Products, Fueling Solutions, Imaging & Identification, Pumps & Process Solutions and Refrigeration & Food Equipment. Dover combines global scale with operational agility to lead the markets we serve. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of approximately 24,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible. Headquartered in Downers Grove, Illinois, Dover trades on the New York Stock Exchange under "DOV." Additional information is available at dovercorporation.com.

title: Keller Williams Productivity Coach
description:
Keller Williams Productivity Coach

Keller Williams Legendary is seeking a dynamic and driven Productivity Coach to join our team.

The Productivity Coach will be responsible for coaching and mentoring real estate agents, helping them develop the necessary skills to meet their business goals and achieve high levels of production. Moving non-capping associates into capping status. This role involves implementing proven Keller Williams systems and models while providing support, accountability, and guidance for both new and seasoned agents. In this role, may continue to conduct your own real estate business .

Key Responsibilities:

: Provide one-on-one and group coaching sessions focused on productivity, goal setting, and business growth.

: Lead training sessions on Keller Williams tools, systems, and best practices, such as Command, Ignite, Bold, etc.

Support the standards of the Program by recruiting a minimum of 5 agents to the program monthly. (Holding recruiting appointments or co-hosting career nights monthly as determined by the Market Center Leadership.) Hold agents accountable for their business plans, tracking their progress, and offering encouragement and actionable feedback to improve performance.

: Track the productivity of agents through regular check-ins, performance metrics, and real-time data, ensuring agents stay on target.

Provide ongoing coaching around lead generation, conversion strategies, time management, objection handling, and closing deals. Conduct weekly skill set training on SCRIPTS and Lead Generation – DAILY from 8:30 – 11:00am (or as otherwise agreed upon)

: Inspire and motivate agents by fostering a culture of success and personal growth within the Market Center.

: Work with the Market Center Leadership and other department heads to ensure coaching aligns with Market Center goals and values.

Qualifications:

: Minimum of 5 years of experience in real estate sales; must have an active real estate license.

: Prior experience in coaching, mentoring, or training roles is highly desirable.

: Adapting to Keller Williams systems, models, and technology platforms (such as Command and KW Connect).

: Strong leadership, communication, and motivational skills to inspire and guide agents to success.

: Ability to set, track, and achieve personal and team goals.

: Comfortable with technology and tools used to drive agent productivity, including CRM systems and lead generation platforms.

: Strong organizational and time management abilities, capable of handling multiple coaching relationships.

Benefits:

Competitive Compensation: Based on performance and agent success metrics.

Professional Development: Access to Keller Williams training programs and coaching development opportunities.

Dynamic Environment: Be a part of a fast-paced, growth-oriented team at one of the leading real estate brokerages.

title: E-COMMERCE INTERNSHIP
description:
**Ecommerce Intern**

**Company**: Alzerina Jewelry

**About Alzerina Jewelry**  
Alzerina Jewelry is a women-owned luxury jewelry brand committed to empowering individuals through sophisticated and unique designs. Our mission is to create elegant jewelry that celebrates individuality and enhances personal style. We are seeking a detail-oriented and enthusiastic **Ecommerce Intern** to assist with various aspects of our online store and digital sales strategy.

**Position Overview**

The Ecommerce Intern will support the ecommerce team in managing and optimizing our online store. This role offers hands-on experience in ecommerce operations, digital marketing, and customer experience within a growing fashion and jewelry brand.

**Responsibilities**

* **Product Listings**: Assist in creating and maintaining accurate and engaging product listings, including descriptions, images, and pricing.
* **Inventory Management**: Support inventory tracking and updates to ensure product availability and accurate stock levels on the ecommerce platform.
* **Order Processing**: Help process and fulfill online orders, ensuring timely and accurate delivery to customers.
* **Website Updates**: Assist with updates and improvements to the website, including content changes, promotions, and visual enhancements.
* **Customer Service**: Provide support for customer inquiries and issues, including order status, returns, and product information.
* **Marketing Support**: Help with the execution of digital marketing campaigns, including email marketing, social media promotions, and online advertising.
* **Analytics & Reporting**: Track and analyze ecommerce performance metrics (e.g., sales data, customer behavior) and assist in generating reports to inform strategy.
* **Competitor Research**: Conduct research on industry trends and competitor strategies to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.

**Desired Skills & Experience**

* **Ecommerce Knowledge**: Familiarity with ecommerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, WooCommerce) and online retail operations.
* **Attention to Detail**: Strong attention to detail for managing product listings, inventory, and order processing.
* **Digital Marketing**: Basic understanding of digital marketing principles, including SEO, email marketing, and social media.
* **Customer Service Skills**: Excellent communication skills and a customer-focused approach to handling inquiries and resolving issues.
* **Analytical Skills**: Ability to interpret data and provide insights to optimize ecommerce performance.
* **Technical Proficiency**: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word) and familiarity with basic graphic design tools (e.g., Canva) is a plus.
* **Organizational Skills**: Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.
* **Interest in Fashion/Jewelry**: Passion for the fashion or jewelry industry and a desire to learn about ecommerce within this sector.

**What We Offer**

* Practical experience in managing and optimizing an ecommerce platform for a luxury jewelry brand.
* Flexible working hours with remote work options.
* Opportunity to work in a collaborative, supportive environment where your contributions are valued.
* Exposure to various aspects of ecommerce and digital marketing within the fashion and jewelry industry.

**This internship is home based office**

**Lunch and snack will be provided at work.**

**How to Apply:**

If you are passionate about jewelry, sales, and building relationships with customers, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you are interested in this internship to info@alzerina.com

Best Regards,

Alzerina and Team

Alzerina Jewelry

description:
**Content Creator Internship**

**Company**: Alzerina Jewelry

**About Alzerina Jewelry**  
Alzerina Jewelry is a women-owned brand focused on empowering individuals through elegant, handcrafted jewelry. Our mission is to create unique pieces that celebrate strength, beauty, and individuality. We are looking for a creative and passionate **Content Creator Intern** to join our team and help bring our story and vision to life through engaging digital content.

**Position Overview**

The Content Creator Intern will be responsible for developing and executing creative content across multiple platforms to enhance Alzerina Jewelry’s brand visibility. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience in content creation, social media marketing, and storytelling within the fashion and jewelry industry.

**Responsibilities**

* **Content Development**: Create high-quality visual and written content (photos, videos, reels, and posts) that aligns with Alzerina Jewelry’s brand and mission of women empowerment and elegance.
* **Social Media Strategy**: Assist with planning and executing content strategies for Instagram, TikTok, and other relevant platforms.
* **Brand Storytelling**: Collaborate with the marketing team to produce narratives that highlight the unique craftsmanship and values of the brand.

* **Community Engagement**: Help manage engagement by responding to comments, and direct messages, and fostering conversations that align with our brand’s message of empowerment.

title: Regional Audio Visual Manager
description:
*Convene is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we believe that diverse teams are the best teams. We live our values of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity & Teamwork) and strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where everyone can be their true selves, where we all show up for each other. In line with our goal to be 1% better every day, we are committed to listening, learning, growing and improving. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to join us on this journey.*

**Regional AV Manager**

The Regional AV Manager oversees all services used to deliver technology to our customers and associates including networking, desktop support, audio, video, HSIA, audio & video conferencing, webcasting, and lighting for different types of meetings and events throughout Convene’s NYC region. The Regional AV Manager works closely with the teams to deliver an excellent meeting, conference, and working experience.

The Regional AV Manager oversees Technology Managers, AV Supervisors, and AV Operations Specialists in supporting/executing customer needs and helps to manage, train, and lead the teams in personal, technical, and career development/training. The person in this role will also work directly with the sales and event teams to deliver excellent client experiences.

**What You’ll Do:** 

**People Management, Training & Development:**

* Day-to-day management of the AV Specialists and Managers in the NYC region
* Oversight of the AV Operation Specialist(AVOS) Pool for development road mapping and adherence to training standards.
* Oversight of the AVOS Convene Certification process for all relevant On The Job Training Modules.
* Interview and hire prospective candidates for all positions in the department using targeted selection.
* Participate in employee appraisals.
* Cross-train in other conference center-related areas.
* Assist with developing a healthy employee relations climate, including employee motivation and coaching.
* Participate in collaborative project efforts with both the technology team and other departments
* Stay current on industry trends in special events/meetings through benchmarking, trade publications, competitive shopping, and special event conferences.
* Review all departmental SOPs quarterly and update them as needed.

**Operations Management:**

* Provide ad-hoc troubleshooting and assistance to customers of all technology competency levels
* Management/troubleshooting of AV equipment, including but not limited to audio, video, lighting, computer networking systems, and hardware both in-house and client systems
* Evaluation and troubleshooting personal computer hardware and software, peripheral devices, mobile devices, and network component problems
* Preprogram coordination with client ensuring that all of their technological needs are met and in place for their arrival
* Ensure that booking guidelines are followed and that all leaders are maximizing space and revenue through audits and the weekly program execution order meetings
* Provide genuine anticipatory customer service by establishing good working relationships with Convene team members, divisions, and vendors
* Attend PEO, Pre-Con, and pre-production meetings as needed
* Direct day-to-day support of Technology Managers including financial management and scheduling
* Create weekly schedules for Technology Specialists and coordinate with various properties to share resources
* Delegate tasks to other Technology Managers, Supervisors, and Specialists

**Customer Service:**

* Make personal contact and maintain positive relationships with clients and assist with any reasonable requests during programs.
* Interact with Sales and Production teams to ensure a thorough understanding of the client experience with Convene prior to the start of their meeting/event.
* Liaise with the AV Sales organization to identify impactful opportunities for cross departmental collaboration in support of the Client.
* Prepare and follow-up on all sales quotes using revenue maximization techniques in accordance with Convene standard operating procedures.
* Assist in any areas of daily operation.

**Administrative:**

* Responsible for weekly financial reporting of client programs, tracking labor hours/dollar amounts, as well as spending.
* Direct oversight and ownership, alongside the Area Directors of Operations and GMs, of all property P&L responsibilities.
* Responsible for Vendor management including, but not limited to, labor procurement, equipment rental, and relationship management with all vendors.
* Weekly auditing of aging reports from Vendors to ensure all properties within the region are in good standing.
* Participate in the annual budgeting process for Regional properties.
* Completion of weekly/monthly status reports for the region in tandem with the Area Directors of Operations.
* Maintain and uphold Convene’s cultural standards.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.
* Show initiative and proactive drive to solve problems.
* Portray a polished, professional image according to Convene dress code standards.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Flexible, long, and weekend hours sometimes required
* Ability to move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects up to 25 pounds without assistance
* Ability to reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping

company: Joseph bulfamante and son inc. landscape construction
description:
Domenick Bulfamante and sons Inc. is a reputable landscaping and outdoor solutions provider dedicated to enhancing outdoor spaces and creating beautiful landscapes. We take pride in our commitment to quality, creativity, and customer satisfaction. As we continue to grow, we are seeking an enthusiastic and results-oriented Landscaping Salesperson to join our team and contribute to our success.

**Job Summary:**

As a Landscaping Salesperson, you will be a key player in driving sales and expanding our client base. Your primary responsibility will be to engage with potential clients, understand their landscaping needs, and present compelling solutions. We are looking for a self-motivated individual with excellent communication skills, a passion for landscaping, and a proven ability to close deals.

**Responsibilities:**

**Customer Engagement:**

* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients through effective communication and rapport-building.
* Conduct consultations to understand clients' landscaping needs and provide tailored solutions.
* Present and explain landscaping proposals to clients, addressing their questions and concerns.

**Sales Generation:**

* Proactively seek out new business opportunities and leads.
* Meet and exceed sales targets through effective prospecting and closing techniques.
* Utilize LMN or other CRM software to track sales activities and manage customer accounts
* Collaborate with the sales team and other departments to optimize the overall sales process.
* Conduct outside sales visits to meet with clients and present product offerings

**Product Knowledge:**

* Stay informed about current landscaping trends, products, and services.
* Effectively communicate the features and benefits of our landscaping solutions to potential clients.
* Attend training sessions and workshops to enhance product knowledge and sales skills.

**Documentation and Follow-Up:**

* Prepare and submit accurate and timely sales documentation, including contracts and proposals.
* Analyze sales data and trends to identify areas for improvement
* Follow up with clients to ensure satisfaction and address any post-sales inquiries.
* Maintain organized records of client interactions and sales activities.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in sales, preferably in the landscaping or related industry.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to understand and articulate landscaping concepts and solutions.
* Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset.
* Excellent negotiation and closing skills.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive base salary and commission structure.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement.
* Collaborative and supportive team environment.
* Health, dental, and vision insurance options.
* Employee discounts on company products and services.

If you are a passionate and driven individual with a flair for sales and a love for landscaping, we invite you to apply for the Landscaping Salesperson position. Join us in creating outdoor spaces that bring joy and beauty to our clients' lives!

Please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant sales experience and explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this position to [Email Address].

title: INSTAGRAM INTERNSHIP
description:
**Instagram Content Creator Internship**

**About Alzerina Jewelry**  
Alzerina Jewelry is a women-owned luxury jewelry brand committed to empowering women through elegant, unique designs. Our mission is to celebrate individuality and strength, crafting pieces that embody timeless beauty and empowerment.

We are seeking a creative and passionate **Instagram Content Creator Intern** to help share our story and values through social media.

**Position Overview**

As the Instagram Content Creator Intern, you will play a key role in building and maintaining Alzerina Jewelry’s presence on Instagram. You’ll be responsible for creating and curating content that reflects our brand’s commitment to elegance and women’s empowerment. This is a unique opportunity to develop social media skills while contributing to a brand that celebrates and uplifts women.

**Responsibilities**

* **Content Creation**: Design visually captivating posts, stories, and reels that showcase our jewelry, events, and the message of women’s empowerment.
* **Content Planning**: Collaborate with the team to plan a consistent content calendar that aligns with Alzerina Jewelry’s mission and aesthetic.
* **Storytelling**: Craft compelling narratives and captions that highlight the brand’s focus on elegance, empowerment, and individuality.
* **Engagement**: Interact with our community, respond to messages and comments, and foster a space for meaningful conversations about women empowerment and fashion.
* **Influencer Collaboration**: Assist in influencer outreach and partnerships, identifying individuals who align with our values.
* **Analytics & Insights**: Track Instagram metrics (likes, engagement, followers) and provide insights to help improve and optimize content strategy.

**Desired Skills & Experience**

* **Instagram Expertise**: Strong knowledge of Instagram features, including Reels, Stories, IGTV, and Instagram Shopping.
* **Creativity & Visual Design**: Ability to create visually engaging content that resonates with our audience and conveys the elegance of our jewelry.
* **Passion for Women Empowerment**: A genuine interest in women empowerment, fashion, and the celebration of individuality.
* **Copywriting**: Excellent writing skills to craft engaging, on-brand captions that tell our story.
* **Trend Awareness**: Familiarity with current social media trends and the ability to adapt them to align with Alzerina Jewelry’s vision.
* **Organization & Time Management**: Ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple projects, and keep content schedules on track.
* **Interest in Fashion & Jewelry**: Passion for jewelry, fashion, and empowering women is highly preferred.

**What We Offer**

* A chance to work with a women-owned brand dedicated to empowering women.
* Hands-on experience managing and growing a brand’s Instagram account.
* Collaborative, supportive environment where your creativity is valued.
* Opportunity to build your portfolio
* **This is an internship opportunity**
* **School credit is available or consider this experience valuable for your resume.**
* **Breakfast and lunch are provided**
* **We provide 50% of subway cost**

If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with us and contribute to the growth of Alzerina Jewelry, we'd love to hear from you!

Best Regards,

Alzerina and Team

Alzerina Jewelry

Website: www.alzerina.com

Office: +1 347 644 7212

* YouTube - Alzerina Jewelry
* Facebook - Alzerina Jewelry

* Instagram - Alzerina Jewelry
* Twitter - Alzerina Jewelry
* Facebook - Cabo Verde Believe

title: SOCIAL CARE NETWORK PROGRAM COORDINATOR- HYBRID - TARRYTOWN, NY SALARY $62.5K - NON-NEGOTIABLE
description:
***Creating Communities of Health and Wellness for ALL*** 

We are a network advancing whole person services and supports designed to address health inequities, focus on accessibility, and deliver trauma informed care across the lifespan. Our work covers the spectrum from prevention to complex care. We facilitate partnerships among government, community resources, primary care providers, hospitals, schools, social and behavioral health services, payers and others to ensure everyone has a path to whole person health. Equity and inclusion are a hallmark of how we work. We are intentional in inviting people to join us in creating whole health pathways through co-design emphasizing diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging.

We are seeking a dedicated and organized Program Coordinator to join our team. Reporting to the Social Care Network Director, the Program Coordinator will play a vital role in ensuring the efficient and effective coordination of services, promoting seamless communication, and contributing to the continuous quality improvement of our program.

A. Duties and Responsibilities

o Manage the Learning Management System -Docebo for the Social Care Network (SCN).

o Coordinate, organize, and plan training sessions and webinars including but not limited to:

* Work with SCN Director to conduct all preparatory work to record and edit training sessions.
* Research and secure consultants to develop content,
* If necessary, plan, coordinate, organize, and implement in-person training events.

o Collaborate closely with the SCN Director in the development, implementation, and monitoring of program goals, policies, procedures, and quality standards, protocols.

o Develop and read reports as well as conduct data validation on HVCC’s SCN platform and other portals.

o Be the first Point of Access for the SCN Program

* Be the frontline person for all communication, then triage internally to all team members
* Assign SCN screenings received to an organization within the network.
* Keep track of network capacity.
* Verify program eligibility of members the network would like to work with.

o Manage MCO requests, this can include but is not limited to:

* Downloading and sharing member charts upon audit request,
* Sharing contact information for the assigned organization,

o Provide basic technical support within the Electronic Health Record to the network this can include.

* Pull data for quality initiatives.
* Maintain Key Performance Indicator Report.

o Facilitate communication among healthcare providers, community resources, and program participants to ensure collaboration.

o Assist in organizing and planning team meetings, SCN Office Hours, workflow and service delivery workgroups, and other meetings as necessary.

o Work with SCN director, and Grants and Contract Manager to onboard new providers into the SCN. This includes but is not limited to conducting trainings on the following topics:

* SCN Policy & Procedures
* Referral Management Platform
* Cultural and linguistic competency service delivery
* Child abuse and neglect
* Trauma-Informed Care
* Implicit-bias
* Motivational Interviewing
* HIPAA
* Cyber Security

o May be called upon to assist with special projects and assume responsibility for the development, administration, and promotion of specific projects.

o Assist the Senior Director of Network Development & Senior Director of Data on seasonal projects.

B. Office Duties

o Maintain electronic filing.

o Provide phone coverage to assist members, the network, and community partners with questions and/or concerns.

o Monitor faxes and mail received, ensuring the office is always HIPAA compliant.

o Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of work experience required, and 3 -years of experience in customer-facing positions.

o Previous experience in program coordination, care coordination, or related roles within a healthcare or social services setting

o Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks.

o Previous experience in providing on-time, friendly, helpful, and overall excellent customer service.

o Exceptional and effective interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team.

o Innovative thinker and problem-solver.

o Some knowledge in data collection, analysis, and reporting.

o General knowledge of healthcare systems, community resources, and social services.

o Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software

o NYS Healthcare experience (preferred)

title: Sterile Processing Technician - Full Time
description:
Overview:

Our team members are the heart of what makes us better. At Hackensack Meridian *Health* we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community. Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.  

The certified Sterile Processing Technician within the Sterile Processing Department (SPD) performs all tasks associated with the processing of surgical instruments and medical devices including cleaning, decontamination, assembly, sterilization/high level disinfection; monitoring of environmental conditions, sterilization processes, and HLD processes; assembly and dispatching of case carts and emergency carts; and inventory and ordering of SPD supplies.
Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a Sterile Processing Technician at Hackensack Meridian *Health* includes:  

1. Assists in processing of instruments, surgical trays, and surgical case carts. Performs duties in the Processing area. Maintains knowledge of instruments and trays and can assemble trays and sets as detailed on set layout sheets. Can operate correctly all machinery associated with the Decontamination and Processing area and identify problems that affect the quality of the product produced.  

2. Checks expiration dates on sterile items. Checks for outdated items and takes appropriate action if discovered.  

3. Demonstrates proper phone etiquette. Uses proper procedure with callers on the business unit and OR Hotline phones in a courteous and efficient manner.  

4. Makes daily soil rounds of the medical units. Performs daily soil rounds, visiting all required areas and returns all items to SPD for processing.  

5. Performs functions in Decontamination area. Responsible for cleaning the instruments, trays and carts. Performs decontamination duties without direction. Has the ability to control the workflow in the Decontamination area.  

6. Records all processed loads and keeps accurate records. Accurately enters information into record books required to track processed loads. Records Biological indicators into required logs and places Biological indicators into the proper incubator to be processed. Removes Biological indicators after proper time period and accurately records outcome of testing.  

7. Responsible for SPD department stock. Puts away supplies in the SPD department and rotates stock as needed. Duties are performed with reasonable speed and definite accuracy.  

8. Responsible for the daily operations of the business unit in the Supervisor's absence. Demonstrates ability to take charge and appropriately assigns team members in the interest of business unit and ultimately patient care.  

9. Responsible for the daily operations of the business unit in the Coordinator's and/or Supervisor's absence. (Technicians with charge responsibilities.) Demonstrates the ability to take charge of the processing functions by appropriately facilitating the team members in the performance of their assignments in the best interest of the business unit and ultimately patient care.  

10. Steam and Sterrad sterilization of instruments and medical devices. Operates steam and Sterrad sterilization equipment in compliance with manufacturer's instructions, policies and procedures, and Infection Prevention.  

11. Lifts a minimum of 30 lbs., pushes and pulls a minimum of 50 lbs. and stands a minimum of length of shift.  

12. Other duties and/or projects as assigned.  

13. Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.


Qualifications:

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
1. High School diploma, general equivalency diploma (GED), and/or GED equivalent programs.
  

2. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  

3. Proficient computer skills that include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.  

Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
1. Experience with STERRAD sterilization.  

Licenses and Certifications Required:
1. National Certification: Certified Registered Central Service Technician (CRCST) or Certification Board for Sterile Processing and Distribution (CBSPDT).  

Working Conditions:
Lifts a minimum of 30 lbs., pushes and pulls a minimum of 50 lbs. and stands a minimum of length of shift.  

If you feel the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

At **Hackensack Meridian** ***Health*** we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community.  

Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.  

The **Supervisor of Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) Data** plays a critical role in advancing Hackensack Meridian Health's commitment to addressing the social factors that impact patient health and well-being. This multifaceted position extends beyond direct patient care, encompassing responsibilities related to regulatory compliance, data management, technology integration, interdisciplinary collaboration, and data analysis for the Community Health Worker (CHW) program**.**
Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a **Supervisor of Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) Data** at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:* SDOH Regulatory Compliance: a. Ensure compliance with HHS regulations on SDOH screening. b. Develop and implement policies and procedures for SDOH data collection, analysis, and reporting. c. Ensure integration of SDOH screening into Community Health Worker (CHW) programs workflows.
* EPIC SDOH Module Utilization: a. Train staff on the effective use of the EPIC SDOH module. b. Identify and document social determinants of health for patients within the electronic health record system. c. Collaborate with IT/DTS to ensure optimal functionality, troubleshoot issues, and implement updates.
* Unite Us' Referral Platform Management: a. Ensure proper integration of the `Unite Us' platform with other digital systems. Serve as the liaison between the Unite Us platform and the IT/DTS team b. Optimize data exchange and interoperability between Unite Us and the electronic health record system. c. Build and maintain relationships with community-based partners to facilitate referrals and resource utilization.
* Database Management: a. Oversee the management of the SDOH database, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information on community resources, social services, and patient interventions. b. Work closely with IT/DTS to implement data security measures and privacy protocols in compliance with healthcare regulations.
* IT/Digital Technology Integration: a. Collaborate with IT/DTS to integrate SDOH data seamlessly into existing digital health infrastructure. b. Participate in the development and enhancement of digital tools and applications that support SDOH initiatives and streamline data collection and reporting.
* Interdisciplinary Collaboration: a. Facilitate communication between the SDOH team and IT/digital technology services teams to address technical challenges, implement system improvements, and enhance user experience. b. Facilitate communication between the SDOH team and clinical and allied health services teams to address patient needs and improve care coordination. c. Work collaboratively to develop and maintain standardized protocols for capturing and sharing SDOH data across various digital platforms.
* Data Analysis and Reporting: a. Analyze data from the CHW program to assess the impact of interventions, identify trends, and generate reports. b. Develop and implement data analysis tools for the CHW program to track progress, measure outcomes, and identify areas for improvement. c. Collaborate with IT to design and implement data analysis tools for assessing the impact of SDOH interventions, identifying trends, and generating reports. d. Ensure that data analytics systems align with the organization's strategic goals and objectives.
* Training and Education: a. Collaborate with IT to develop and deliver training programs for staff on the effective use of digital tools, including the EPIC SDOH module and Unite Us platform. b. Provide ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to ensure staff competency in utilizing digital resources.
* Supervision of the SDOH Coordinator: a. Provide direct supervision of the SDOH Coordinator. b. Delegate tasks and responsibilities effectively. c. Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback for professional development.
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.


Qualifications:
**Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:*** Bachelor's degree with +5 years data management experience or Master's degree in Public Health, or a related field with data management experience.
* Prior experience working in data analytics and coordination, preferably within a large hospital system.
* Familiarity with EPIC SDOH module and Unite Us or similar referral platforms.
* Experience with data analysis and reporting, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
* Knowledge of community resources and social service agencies.
* Experience supervising staff is preferred
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient computer skills that may include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.

**Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:*** Passionate about addressing health disparities and improving patient outcomes.


If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

title: Front Desk Hospitality Agent
description:
Sonder is on a mission to revolutionize hospitality and make a world of better stays open to all. No two Sonders are the same – each property has a bespoke design and contains a mix of rooms, suites, and apartments. Though each Sonder is unique, our mobile app allows guests to effortlessly navigate their stay. From check-in to checkout, everything they need is just a tap away. To be better is a never-ending pursuit and revolutions don’t happen overnight. But, together, we can forever change the way people stay, for the better.
We are looking for someone who breathes hospitality operations and is energized by the opportunity to maximize, motivate, and inspire a team to deliver an amazing Sonder guest experience. Our Sonder locations are distributed across a city in different shapes, sizes, ages, and styles, and we pride ourselves on offering a hotel-like service. That’s what you’ll own.
Life At Sonder
We aspire to build a workplace where employees can thrive. Our culture shapes how we make decisions, how we conduct meetings, how we communicate, and how we treat each other. It’s the coordinated way in which we work that gives us a shot at achieving the epic tale we hope to be part of. Our Leadership Principles are a foundational part of our culture and they play a vital role in guiding the values and actions of our team members. Each of these principles is at the heart of what we do. Check out this article to find out more about our Culture and Principles.
Our Front Desk Hospitality Agents are the face of Sonder and live our leadership principle “Extend Hospitality to All.” This versatile role is perfect for anyone who loves interacting with guests, creatively solving problems, and is committed to delivering exceptional guest service. At Sonder, we believe that guest satisfaction is paramount, and our Front Desk Hospitality Agents play a crucial role in delivering memorable stays for our guests. If you’re ready for an evolving and fast-paced environment that is focused on delivering amazing guest experiences, we’d love to hear from you!
The Opportunity:* Be the face of Sonder, working collaboratively with team members to create an exceptional first impression on our guests, visitors, and all internal and external partners from the front desk.
* Guide guests through the technology-rich Sonder experience, ensuring they make the most of their stay by engaging with the Sonder app and self-service features.
* Communicate with guests in-person and through digital communication systems to anticipate and address their needs, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable experience throughout their stay.
* Handle all guest interactions with the highest quality of service and professionalism, owning guest issues to resolution and accommodating requests whenever possible.
* Ensure the maintenance, cleanliness, and organization of both guest-facing and back-of-house working spaces, contributing to a welcoming and efficient environment for both guests and team members.
* Flexibly support the back-of-house team on a day-to-day basis as needs arise, including housekeeping quality audits, inventory checks, and minor maintenance and technology issues; Support multiple Sonder properties throughout the local market, as required
* Assist market leadership with administrative tasks to keep all operations running smoothly and contribute to continuous improvement in the guest experience.


Who We Look For:* Demonstrated experience working in hotels, restaurants, or customer-facing hospitality, service, and/or customer experience roles.
* Personable, service-minded, and positive; you love speaking with guests in-person and through digital support channels.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to addressing guest needs and a desire to “get it done” for our guests.
* Strong computer literacy and writing skills, and comfortable switching between multiple desktop and mobile applications.
* Organized, hardworking, and detail-oriented; someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment with an ability to work effectively both independently and in a team.
* Flexible schedule and open to working evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to remain standing for extended periods of time and lift and/or carry items weighing up to 50 pounds.
* Proficiency in languages other than English is an asset.
* This role requires regular access to a reliable smartphone for work purposes (expense reimbursement available)
* This role requires reliable transportation and willingness to travel between properties on a daily basis when working. (Reliable transportation includes biking, walking, public transportation, and/or other forms of transportation that provide reasonable work associated transit times between locations)


Hourly Pay Rate: $22.00/hr plus benefits & perks
#LI-Onsite
Benefits
We offer attractive employee travel perks for any Sonder location as well as competitive stock, health and lifestyle benefits. For eligible employees, benefits may include:* Competitive compensation
* Generous stock plan
* Medical, dental and vision insurance (where applicable)
* Flexible vacation
* Wellness and volunteering days
* Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders
* Workplace flexibility (for remote-specified positions only) #ABetterWaytoWork


Learn More About Sonder* Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability
* Data Privacy Policy
* Blog: Sonder Stories
* Instagram: @sonderstays


Equal Opportunity
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other classification protected by applicable state, federal or local law. *Extend Hospitality To All* is one of Sonder’s Leadership Principles. Living up to that principle means fully embracing diversity: ensuring that all of our employees, guests, partners, and communities feel safe, respected, included, cared for, and empowered.
As part of our commitment to creating a workplace open to all, we have created *Sonder Circles*, also known as employee resource groups. These groups aim to foster a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace aligned with the communities they serve.
If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please email Recruiting.
